intro: Lagynias dryadum, commonly known as the dryad's lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant features strap-like leaves that are often bluish-green in color, and it produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
